intro: Varronia corchorifolia, commonly known as the Mexican bejucillo, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Varronia corchorifolia is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
